src: “Looks like capture” Cohren guessed as the two Sentinels disappeared into the cloud of ash and smoke. Shouting and gunshots echoed from the ridge, but quickly ceased. A moment later the two sentinels marched back, pulling someone behind them, their boots dragging behind them. When they reached the safety of the platoon they threw the figure to the ground, he grunted in pain as they landed hard in the mud and snow. Shaw walked up to the figure, who was starting to get up. He then turned to one of the Sentinels. “How many?” “Three dead, sir” The Sentinel answered. “The rest fled on foot” Shaw nodded and turned towards Cohren and Criath, who were standing close by. “Would you two be so kind as to stow this man away?”

Il grogna de douleur en s'effondrant dans la boue et la neige. Shaw marcha vers l'individu, qui commençait à se relever. Il se tourna vers l'une des Sentinelles. "Combien ?" "Trois morts, chef", répondit la Sentinelle. "Les autres ont fui à pied." Shaw hocha la tête et se tourna vers Cohren et Craith, qui se tenaient à côté. "Tous les deux, auriez-vous l'amabilité de nous débarrasser de cet homme ?"

src: After around an hour, one of the new recruits, Cohren, remembered his name being Orson, spoke up. “Lieutenant, you’ve been here since the start of the war, right?” “Yup, Operation Firestorm,” Cohren answered. “We thought it would be over in a few weeks, but…we underestimate them” “Underestimated is putting it lightly” Nemic joined in the conversation. “They had more weapons and manpower than we were prepared for. Hell, we should see it from the route were taking” “Well, I’ll stand defiantly for the Federation” Orson said defiantly. “I’ll not let those terrorist scare me” “You say that now, but from what I have seen, most fresh eighteen year old recruits like yourself dive to cover as soon as you hear a gunshot” Craith stated.

src: “A FOB outside Ianlos. We are being sent to help support the ground assault” Cohren answered, taking a drag from his cigarette. Half of him blamed Craith for getting him into smoking, but a year of combat does a lot to you, so he didn’t say anything. “Shit. Its getting bad on the front, '' Nemic muttered. “All the news leaving this place is ‘Support the war effort. Send aid to the Kurgan Front’ how about sending aid to the Howland Front” “Amen brother” Cohren said as he flicked the remains of the cigarette into the mud. “Anyway, we're heading out with the 1st armored platoon, so we don’t have to walk. Captain Shaw should be their” “Shaw got us a ride?” Nemic asked, a little surprised. “Yup. Honestly, he isn’t as bad as I thought he was. I mean, he’s not great, but he isn’t unbearable”
tgt: "Une base opérationnelle avancée à l'extérieur d'Ianlos. On a été envoyés pour soutenir l'assaut terrestre", répondit Cohren en tirant sur sa cigarette. Une partie de lui blâmait Craith de l'avoir initié au tabac, mais une année de combats, ça change un homme, et il se tut. "Merde. La situation se dégrade sur le front", marmonna Nemic. "Toutes les nouvelles qui viennent de cet endroit, c'est 'Contribuez à l'effort de guerre. Envoyez de l'aide au front de Kurgan'. Pourquoi ne pas envoyer de l'aide au front de Howland ?" "Amen, mon frère", dit Cohren en balançant son mégot dans la boue. "De toute façon, nous partons avec le premier peloton blindé, nous n'aurons donc pas à marcher. Le capitaine Shaw devrait être là." "Shaw nous a eu un transport ?", demanda Nemic, un peu surpris. "Ouep. Honnêtement, il n'est pas aussi mauvais que je le pensais. Je veux dire, il n'est pas exceptionnel, mais il n'est pas insupportable."

src: “I guess we’ll find out,” Cohren said with a laugh. Orson didn’t continue the conversation. “Exodus XO, Exodus CO” Cohrens radio crackled. “We're picking up heat signatures 350 yards out, 20 degrees right” Cohren pulled himself up to the top of the tank and pushed his Optic Goggles. Switching them to Thermal, he could see heat signatures in the distance. “Yup, I see them” Cohren responded, using his throat mic. “Enemy’s?” The other recruit, Natayla, asked. “Can’t tell,” Cohren stated. He reached for his mic and spoke. “Exodus Company, hold fire unless fired upon, let's draw them out As they drew closer, the little heat signatures turned from blobs to more distinct shapes. As they drew closer, one of them ran for something and grabbed it before rusing back to the small ridge they were on. The figures dropped down into firing positions.
tgt: "Je pense que nous serons vite fixés", dit Corhen en riant. Orson ne donna pas suite à la conversation. "Exodus XO, Exodus CO", grésilla la radio de Cohren. "Nous détectons des signatures thermiques à environ 300 mètres, 20 degrés droite." Cohren se hissa au sommet du char et enfila ses lunettes optiques. En activant la vision thermique, il put voir des signatures thermiques au loin. "Ouep, je les vois", répondit Cohren via son micro de gorge. "Des ennemis ?", demanda l'autre recrue, Natayla. "Impossible à dire", déclara Cohren. Il activa son micro et dit : "Compagnie Exodus, ne tirez pas à moins qu'on vous tire dessus, faisons-les sortir." À mesure qu'ils s'approchaient, les petites signatures thermiques passaient de taches floues à des formes plus distinctes. Alors qu'ils approchaient davantage, l'une d'elles courut vers quelque chose, s'en empara, puis se précipita à nouveau vers la petite crête où elles étaient. Les silhouettes se mirent en position de tir.

src: The company dispersed, joining together in their squads and their sergeants had them mount up on one of the tanks. Cohren pulled himself onto one of the tanks farther up on the convoy, joining Nemic, Craith, and two new recruits. Cohren remembered them arriving a few days ago, but didn’t know much about them. Sitting on the side, dangling his legs on the side, he adjusted his pack and radio set, which connected to his earpiece and throat mic. “Hey Cohren, does Harris still have Snowball?” Nemic asks as they got settled in. “You mean his chicken he stole?” Cohren remembered the morning they had stolen him from a farm. “Yeah, i'm pretty sure”
tgt: La compagnie se dispersa, chacun rejoignant son unité, et les sergents les firent monter sur les chars. Cohren se hissa à bord de l'un des blindés, à l'avant du convoi, et rejoignit Nemic, Craith et deux nouvelles recrues. Cohren se souvint de leur arrivée quelques jours plus tôt, mais il ne savait pas grand-chose sur eux. Assis sur le côté, les jambes pendantes, il ajusta son paquetage et son équipement radio, qui était connecté à son oreillette et à son micro de gorge. "Hé Cohren, Harris a toujours Snowball ?", demanda Nemic alors qu'ils s'installaient. "Tu parles du poulet qu'il a volé ?" Cohren se souvenait du matin où ils l'avaient volé dans une ferme. "Oui, j'en suis sûr".
